other_tests.findings: Marked asymmetric enlargement and hypervascularity of the right testicle; hypoechoic region in the mediastinum testis likely related to edema due to infection or inflammation; enlargement and hypervascularity of the epididymis; associated complex hydrocele with septations and internal debris.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Six weeks later, repeat ultrasonography revealed further enlargement of the right testicle (from approximately 19 ml to 33 ml); hypoechoic region in the right mediastinum testis increased in size; multiple new nonspecific hypoechoic areas scattered throughout the remaining testicular parenchyma.

other_tests.findings: Right orchiectomy specimen revealed an ill-defined tannish-yellow mass (3.6 cm) with granulomas in the testicle and epididymis.
All four mycobacterial cultures of urine grew Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up cultures obtained at 2 months of treatment and at the end of treatment were sterile.
